meanings.definition: To face or confront boldly or defiantly.
meanings.sent1: She was outbraving the storm by standing tall in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The knight outbraved the dragon by standing his ground.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse outbraved the big cat by squeaking loudly.
meanings.sent4: The flower outbraved the weeds by blooming brightly in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The child outbraved his fear of the dark by singing a brave song.

meanings.definition: To surpass in bravery or courage.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter outbraved all others by rescuing the kitten from the burning building.
meanings.sent2: She outbraved her fears and climbed to the mountain peak.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outbraved the other animals by fearlessly gathering nuts.
meanings.sent4: The sun outbraved the clouds and shone brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The hero outbraved all odds and saved the town from disaster.
